docstr: `ABORT` — Abort the program ### Description `ABORT` causes immediate termination of the program. On operating systems that support a core dump, `ABORT` will produce a core dump. It will also print a backtrace, unless `-fno-backtrace` is given. ### Syntax `CALL ABORT` ### Return value Does not return. ### Example ``` program test_abort   integer :: i = 1, j = 2   if (i /= j) call abort end program test_abort ``` ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Subroutine ### See also EXIT, KILL, BACKTRACE
